author: .fjl
content: I mean, let's not try to be extra confusing by making every packet a handshake attempt.

author: .fjl
content: So, if you say that we can just replace part of the 'proposal 2' IV with fixed bytes, I'm very happy about that.

author: .fjl
content: Because that would mean we don't even need to include it in the spec.

author: .fjl
content: Since the first 16 bytes of the proposal 2 format are just random data, it's OK if your client chooses to make them look like a QUIC header ðŸ™‚
